intro: Cissampelos hexandra, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Cissampelos hexandra is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
